column4: is there a special way to reformat a hard-drive so that it is not recognized as msdos1.  The install process was supposed to use EXT4...
the partition type and file systeem are two different things
why do you want to do that
ok, so you probably just need to re-install Ubuntu depending on what your friend did
are you doing a wubi install ?
from the livecd can you please paste the output of "sudo fdisk -l" please
thank you for your help.  do you see anything weird with that output?
that looks a fine partition table, no problems there
it looks like your install just isn't working
I think I have an answer
look at your partition start and end blocks, there is n overlap
i am trying my 4th install, lets see if i get lucky :P
pay close attention to the partition start/end boundries
don't use an extended partition for no reason
